inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: positive anti-AChR antibody test, single fiber electromyography (SFEMG) was positive

inclusion.criterion: Mild-to-moderate CLN3 disease documented by the UBDRS
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: physical exam and lab studies were not remarkable for any other abnormalities

inclusion.criterion: Participant must be able to independently walk for a distance of at least 20 feet (6 meters)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participant must be able to tolerate swallowing oral medication or have a gastric/jejunostomy tube for drug administration
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: complains of diplopia and fatigue and weakness that affects mainly her upper limbs

exclusion.criterion: Participant has clinically documented generalized motor status epilepticus within 4 weeks of the Baseline visit
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: physical exam and lab studies were not remarkable for any other abnormalities

notes: The patient is a 35-year-old woman with myasthenia gravis, class IIa. She has symptoms that interfere with her job as a research coordinator.
